channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration.

item.description:
Report X-2024111050

  • City: ALTOONA

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: UNION PACIFIC RAILROAD COMPANY
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 3000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Report from yard crew of possible release to top and sides of tank car TILX 135353 in Altoona, WI yard. Inspection by UPRR Hazmat Dept and Rybak Environmental, contractor, found all 8 manway swing bolts less than tool tight. Release was to the top and sides of car only. Manway nozzle and outside car surface cleaned and manway swing bolts properly secured.

item.title: Report X-2024111056
item.description:
Report X-2024111056

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-30T12:29:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-04
  • City: CHASKA
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Jose Perez, CHECKER/DRIVER REG, called safety to report a spill in trailer 401481. Jose stated that when he backed to the customers dock to unload, the customer stated they would not accept the freight (UN3093, CORROSIVE LIQUIDS, OXIDIZING, N.O.S., 8 (5.1), PG II) due to a plug in the center of the top red lid being missing and the freight possibly being contaminated. Jose stated that after inspecting the tote, he found that approximately 8oz of the product had spilled out of the top lid where the plug was missing, onto the side of the tote and the trailer floor. Jose stated he did not see the plug missing when he left the Service Center and looked in the trailer for the plug but could not find it. Jose stated the customer advised he could stay parked at dock door #1 while the cleaning crew assists in cleaning the spill in the trailer and on the tote.

item.title: Report X-2024111058
item.description:
Report X-2024111058

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-30T12:29:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-27
  • City: Highland
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Richard Vance, a road driver, called safety to report a spill coming out of the lead trailer 570210. Richard stated that as he was returning to the tractor after his break, he saw something leaking out of the back of the lead trailer. Richard called safety to report the spill and stated it looked to be about 1 gallon of an adhesive-like product. Richard opened the doors to the lead trailer and found a pallet of UN1263, PAINT RELATED MATERIAL, 3, PG II had tipped over in the back of the trailer. It appeared that one 5-gallon pail had spilled approximately 1 gallon in the back of the trailer and on the ground from leaking out the back of the trailer door. Safety advised that CURA would be called to assist with the spill and not to move the trailer. ABF stated he would remain on standby and let his dispatch know the situation with the lead trailer.~~Tractor: 14026~Lead Trailer: 570210~Gear: 72618~Rear Trailer: 554632~Location: West Bond, I-70 Highland IL 62273, MM27 Rest Area~~CURA: Becca Doris

item.title: Report X-2024111057
item.description:
Report X-2024111057

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-30T12:29:42+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-19
  • City: Saint-Louis
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF FREIGHT SYSTEM, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Operations Manager I Kayla Stangel contacted safety to report a Hazardous Spill. Kayla stated that when they opened the door to trailer 89279, they noticed a pallet containing (1) crushed box of UN1426. Kayla stated that the box leaked 1-ounce of liquid on top of the carboard dunnage. Kayla stated t hat she is unsure how the box became crushed but stated that the box was marked damage upon unload at the 034/SCH facility. Kayla stated that no storm drains or waterways were impacted. Safety contacted CURA and spoke with Rosa Gutierrez. Safety requested CURA to provide the inner packaging of the b ox and the Quantity Held. EWI personnel noted two (2) one quart damaged cans of UN1426 with approximately 0.25 gallon of product released to the cardboard

item.title: Report E-2024110563
item.description:
Report E-2024110563

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-29T12:39:13+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-09-23
  • City: STANSTED
  • State:
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ONE AIR PACKAGE SHIPPED IN JULY 2024 FROM BRAZIL TO THE UNITED KINGDOM WAS RELEASED TO UPS ACCESS POINT, POUND LANE CONVENIENCE, POUND LANE 6, KT19 8RY EPSOM, UNITED KINGDOM ON 15-JULY-2024. THE CONSIGNEE DID NOT PICK UP THE PACKAGE, THUS THE PACKAGE WAS RELEASED BACK TO UPS FOR RETURN TO SHIPPER ON 20-AUGUST-2024. DURING THE RETURN TO SHIPPER PROCESS UNDER RETURN TRACKING NUMBER 1ZC509A80406240368, X-RAY REVEALS ONE BOTTLE OF FLAMMABLE COLOGNE. SDS OBTAINED FROM THE MANUFACTURER REVEALS THE PRODUCT IS CLASSIFIED AS A DANGEROUS GOODS DURING AIR TRANSPORTATION. THE PACKAGE HAD FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT WITHOUT ANY DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS FROM BRAZIL TO THE UNITED KINGDOM PRIOR TO THE UNDECLARED DISCOVERY. UPSCO WAS MADE AWARE OF THE UNDECLARED INCIDENT ON 19-NOVEMBER-2024.

item.description:
Report X-2024111028

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-26
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY, WE DISCOVERED ONE BOX LEAKING A BLUE COLORED INK. THE PACKAGE WAS FULLY MARKED AND LABELED AS UN1210, PRINTING INK WITH AN APPROPRIATE 49CFR SHIPPING PAPER. THE PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED FIVE X ONE QUART (0.94 LITER) BOTTLES OF N-2105 BLUE INK DOT JET INK. THREE OF THE FIVE BOTTLES ARE LEAKING FROM THEIR CLOSURES. PRIOR TO THE LEAKING DISCOVERY THE PACKAGE HAD FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM MCI TO SDF.

item.title: Report E-2024110552
item.description:
Report E-2024110552

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-28T06:19:59+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-25
  • City: Hollins
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDEX CUSTOM CRITICAL, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: We arrived at delivery and after they checked the freight they immediately exited the vehicle and advised that they detected a leak in the valve area of the cylinder so they were refusing the shipment. The doors of the truck were closed/locked and the vehicle was relocated to an empty parking lot on the consignee's property. FedEx Custom Critical (FDCC) contacted a local clean up agency to come on-site to see if the valve could be adjusted to stop the leak or place the cylinder in the delivery facility's pressurized encapsulator for transit back to the shipper. FDCC was notified of the release at 1520. The hazmat response vendor sent a first set of crew to secure the site, they arrived at about 1600. The second set of workers with the appropriate gear arrived at 2115. They were able to adjust the valve which stopped the leak/release of materials. The advised the freight would be secure for transport back to the shipper and would not need to be in the encapsulator.

  • Description: RESPONDED TO AN AIR PACKAGE THAT WAS COLD TO THE TOUCH. THE SOUND OF DRY ICE PELLETS ROLLING INSIDE THE BOX COULD BE HEARD DURING THE SIX-SIDED CHECK. ADDITIONALLY, WE CAN SEE A CLASS 9 DIAMOND LABEL THAT HAS BEEN COMPLETELY COVERED BUT IS BLEEDING THROUGH THE APPLIED WHITE LABELS. THE PACKAGE WEIGHS THIRTEEN POUNDS BUT THE THERMAL TRACKING LABEL INDICATES THE WEIGHT IS ONE POUND. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED APPROXIMATELY FIVE POUNDS OF DRY ICE PELLETS COOLING SCIENETIX COMPREHENSIVE UROGENITAL INFECTION QPCR REAGENT KITS. THERE IS A PACKING SLIP INSIDE THE BOX WITH DRY ICE INDICATED UNDER THE SHIPPING INSTRUCTIONS, PREVIOUS CARRIER AS FEDEX, TRACKING 745334899362. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 11/19/2024 at approximately 1015, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 291445 at the station facility in Indianapolis, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of one fiberboard box containing an additional fiberboard box with a car battery inside. The shipment was discovered due to displaying signs of liquid damage as it began to compromise the integrity of the outer package. Further investigation revealed that the inner package displayed a Corrosive hazard label. The moisture was tested using Litmus paper and confirmed the liquid was indeed acidic. The shipment was isolate and placed in a salvage drum and is being held pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: On November 2, 2024 at 0147 ET, ERTS was contacted by Roadrunner Transportation Systems regarding the release of approximately 15 ounces of Diesel Winter Additive (Flammable Liquids N.O.S. (Xylene, Ethylbenzene) 3, PG II) from one 2-gallon plastic jug. The release was reportedly due a puncture in transit and was contained to the trailer floor. Terminal personnel cleaned up the release with absorbents and the proper PPE. All waste was containerized in one (1) 55-gallon DM, which was then staged onsite pending proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110994
item.description:
Report X-2024110994

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-27T12:24:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: Dulles
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Pkg Info ( TRK NBR=779787375000 PKG TYPE=Package (box/drum/jerrican/composite) PHY STATE=Liquid TRANSPORTATION PHASE=In Transit ) Commodity Info ( UNDG NBR=UN1950 CLASS=21 QTY UOM=Solid - Kilogram PSN TEXT=Aerosol, flammable PKG GRP=N/A SPILLED QTY=0 CONTAINER CAPACITY=0.4 CONTAINER UOM=Solid - Kilogram MATERIAL CONSTRUCTION=A - Metal (any type) NUMBER IN SHIPMENT=1 NUMBER FAILED=1 INNER PKG TYPE=2 - Can TOTAL AMT IN EACH CONTAINER=0.4 TOTAL UOM=Solid - Kilogram )On 11/06/2024 at approximately 2115, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 5028756 at the station location in Dulles, reporting undeclared dangerous goods. The shipment consisted of several bottles of acrylic paint, two bottles of acetone, and a container of spray adhesive, all packaged in a plastic storage bin. The shipment began to display evidence of leakage during loading. Further investigation revealed that the undeclared acetone spilled inside of the tub. While opening the bin to confirm spillage, roughly 84 bottles of acrylic leather paint and a can of spray adhesive was also discovered. The bin did not appear to be prepared in accordance with IATA Regulations, missing the required markings. labeling. packaging and paperwork. The shipment is being held, pending an FAA investigation.

  • Description: At 1612 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal XHG. It was reported that approximately 1 ounce of Vigil Quat released from a plastic tote due unknown cause. The terminal believes it may just be a loose cap, however due to the corrosive nature the SCM has requested a crew responded for clean-up and further assessment. The release impacted trailer # 5633416. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. The contractor cleaned-up the release using absorbent pads and replaced cap on the tote. One 30-gallon DF containing the impacted absorbent pads and contractor PPE was generated and staged for waste disposal. XPO will manage any waste generated from spill responses.

  • Description: At 0038 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at XDE. It was reported that approximately 5 gallons of Chem-Trend PU-16224 released from a 330-gallon metal tote due to the valve at the bottom of the tote was opened by unknown cause during the loading process. The release impacted the concrete at dock door 34. The valve has been closed and is no longer leaking and oil dri was placed for containment. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-gallons of product Chem-Trend released from a 330-gallon metal tote to a 5 x 5 area of the concrete dock floor due to improper loading. Contractors neutralized the area and containerized the impacted absorbents into (1) 55-gallon metal drum. The terminal contained the spill with oil dri. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Description: On October 24, 2024, at 1346 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Atlanta, GA regarding the release of Greasestrip Plus (Sodium Hydroxide Solution). Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 2 cups of Greasestrip Plus (UN1824, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon container onto the trailer floor. The release was reportedly due to products rubbing together and creating a leak, impacting a 4 x 4 area in the trailer. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was neutralized then cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Recovered product was re-palletized for the client per clients instruction. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 55-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

item.title: Report X-2024110901
item.description:
Report X-2024110901

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: SAN JOSE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The shipment was discovered leaking when it was inadvertently placed on its side. The outer box did not have any markings or labels, but the inner box revealed a concealed UN 4G Box of UN 3265, Class 8, PGIII. Inner contents of the UN4G box are 2 plastic bottles @ 2.5 gallons each. 1 bottle was leaking from the cap/top. The labels on the plastic bottles are Ethephon Plant Growth Regulator. The UN4G box was surrounded by empty boxes used as dunnage. The boxes with the Lithium Battery Labels are empty. All of the contents were placed in a salvage drum and held for FAA investigation.

item.title: Report E-2024110456
item.description:
Report E-2024110456

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-21
  • City: NASHVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO Logistics terminal BNA experienced a UN2810 Allyl Amyl Glycolate release from a 55-gallon metal drum. ERTS dispatched contractors to conduct cleanup operations. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2 ounces of product released to a 1 x 1 area of the drum lid due to a loose bung cap. The drum was wiped down, the cap secured and tightened, and a slosh test conducted to ensure no further leaking would occur in transit. The impacted pads and PPE were collected and containerized into a 55-gallon metal drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-20
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KY, RESPONDED TO A LEAKING AIR DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE THAT WAS MARKED AND LABELED AS PAINT, UN1263 WITH A CLASS 3 DIAMOND LABEL, OVERPACK, AND SHIPPERS DECLARATION. THE DANGEROUS GOODS PACKAGE HAD PREVIOUSLY PASSED AN ACCEPTANCE AUDIT AT THE ORIGIN FACILITY. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED THREE INNER BOXES EACH CONTAINING ONE GALLON JUGS OF POLYURETHANE (METH) ACRYLATE RESIN BLEND WITH ONE LEAKING DUE TO A SMALL PUNCTURED AREA AT THE LEFT BOTTOM CORNER OF THE CONTAINER. THE OTHER TWO CONTAINERS WERE NOT LEAKING BUT THE BOTTOM INNER PACKAGING WAS CONTAMINATED.

  • Description: During normal switching operations, yard crew reported seeing a liquid running down the side of UTLX 205315 originating around the manway. A response contractor was called to investigate the leak and repair the car. The contractor found the manway swing bolts were less than tool tight with most being able to be turned by hand. The contractor opened the manway and inspected the manway lid gasket and found it in acceptable condition. The manway was closed and properly secured in a tool tight condition. The other service fittings were inspected with no other exceptions noted.

item.description:
Report I-2024110060

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-15
  • City: HONOLULU
  • State: HI
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AEKO KULA DBA ALOHA AIR CARGO
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Friday, 11/15/2024, a shipper attempted to ship undeclared dangerous goods. The shipper, Onesource Distributors, attempted to ship the same product twice on the same day. He went to two different employees and the shipment was rejected each time. Attempt#1 Shipper arrived at approx. 0912 carrying two boxes with limited quantity labels. Our Crew Chief noticed the label and questioned the shipper. Our employee looked up the SDS sheet online, seen it was a dangerous goods product and rejected the shipment. Attempt#2 The same driver came back at approximately 1403 with a different package. Our Cargo Agent helped him and created the air waybill to accept the shipment. However, our Crew Chief who handled the first attempt noticed the same driver. She had the accepting CargoAgent open the package to inspect it and found that it was the same product however it was not in the original package. The shipper took everything out of the original packages and put it in one different package. The shipment was then rejected again. It was also noted that there was no DG placard displayed on the vehicle this product was transported in by highway. Pictures and screenshots will be submitted.

  • City: HENDERSON

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On a routine transfer operation, two Veolia employees were in the process of transferring general solvent waste from the tanker into a rail car. During this procedure, one of the employees, who was relatively new to the department and task, attempted to collect a sample by disconnecting the hose from the tanker's bottom valve. As the employee unfastened one of the camlock's dog ears, the hose suddenly detached, resulting in an unexpected release of approximately 60 gallons of material. Fortunately, the spill was contained within the designated secondary containment area, which consisted of a concrete pad surrounded by a protective berm. The employee who had been disconnecting the hose was directly exposed to the liquid. Following safety protocols, they immediately utilized the nearby safety shower to decontaminate. Meanwhile, the second employee promptly shut off the external valve on the tanker to halt the flow of liquid and then notified the Environmental Health and Safety (EHS) department about the incident.

item.description:
Report E-2024110464

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-07
  • City: SOUTHFIELD
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A spill occurred when a Veolia employee was moving drums for transportation at a customer's site. While using the customer's drum cart, the employee noticed that the cart's feet were not fully positioned beneath the drum being moved. Recognizing the potential hazard, the employee halted the operation and attempted to properly secure the drum onto the cart. Unfortunately, during this adjustment, the cart suddenly slipped away from the drum, causing it to fall. The drum's impact with the metal feet of the cart resulted in a puncture near its top section. Reacting swiftly, the employee rotated the drum to minimize further liquid leakage. To contain the situation, the damaged drum was promptly overpacked on the customer's premises. Following this precautionary measure, the drum was successfully shipped without any additional complications.

  • City: ALBUQUERQUE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 7500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On October 29, 2024, at 1513 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar personnel in Albuquerque, NM regarding the release of corrosive fryer & grill cleaner. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1 cup of Keystone Fryer & Grill Cleaner (UN1824, 8, II) from (1) 1-gallon jug into the carboard box that it was contained in. The release was reportedly due to a load shift, impacting the carboard along with other jugs of product in the box. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with the proper PPE. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal. All salvaged product was packaged in (1) 55-gallon DM and kept by the client per instruction.

  • Description: On October 24th, 2024, at 1818, personnel at the CSXT Avon, Indiana Yard reported a strong odor in the area TILX301735, a residue tank car of Liquefied Petroleum Gas. The car was isolated and the shipper, DK Trading and Supply/Cenovus, was notified via CHEMTREC (Report #2024-1024-00183). HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found the car leaking from both liquid line valves and the vapor valve. The cause of the releases was all valves being found partially open and secondary closures not secured tool tight. Contractor personnel closed all valves, inspected and installed all secondary closures properly. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Stacy Myers (567-901-1941).

item.title: Report E-2024110455
item.description:
Report E-2024110455

Identified by scraper @ 2024-11-25T12:24:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-10-04
  • City: AVON
  • State: IN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: CSX TRANSPORTATION, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 2000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 10/04/2024, at 2007 hours, personnel at the CSXT Avon, Indiana Yard discovered RDRX 300969, a covered hopper car load of Hazardous Waste, Solid, NOS, leaking from a bottom unloading valve. The car was isolated and the shipper, Blanchard Refining, was of the incident. HEPACO, a CSXT emergency response contractor, was dispatched to the scene and found liquid leaking at the threaded connected between the bottom unloading piping and the unloading valve of the hopper car. Contractor personnel tightened the connection between the valve and the cars piping which stopped the release. The issue identified and corrective actions were communicated to the shippers representative- Jennifer Johnson (209-986-1196). Following securement of the release the car was released.

The sort resumed after the fire department cleared the affected area. There are no markings or information on this package left after the fire department put the fire out. was reported to NCR.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: At 1246 EST on Tuesday, September 24, 2024, a report was made to the Whitewater Township Fire Department of a railcar off-gassing with a spray paint-like odor. The reported railcar, PROX 24041, was documented to contain Styrene Monomer and was located at a railyard near Cleves, OH (39.171181 , -84.763446). The railcar was staged in the Central Railroad of Indiana Cleves Yard. The Whitewater Township Fire Department arrived on site around 1314 to begin cooling efforts. CTEH, SPSI, GHD, HEPACO, Enviro-Serve, and EnviroScience were mobilized to' perform emergency response services. On 9/26/2024 at 1927 EST the evacuation order for Whitewater Township was lifted. 5x(5+1+0)x(5+4) = NARRI 270

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A leak was detected beneath pallet, while staged at the STG Logistics facility, pending transit. Upon inspection, it appeared to have been struck by a forklift. Area was secured, and Environmental Restoration was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC detected one 5 gallon metal drum had been punctured. Approximately 3 gallons of free product were released to the pallet, and warehouse floor. ERLLC utilized absorbent material on the warehouse floor, and containerized the spent absorbent, debris, and leaking drum into one 55-gallon recovery drum. There were no injuries or exposures reported

  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. A leak was detected beneath pallet, while staged at the STG Logistics facility, pending transit. Upon inspection, it appeared to have been struck by a forklift. Area was secured, and Environmental Restoration was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, ERLLC sorted the pallet to detect the leakers. Approximately 3 gallons of free product were released to the pallet, cardboard, and facility floor. ERLLC sorted freight, overpacked 22 contaminated cardboard cartons and damaged bottles into 3 55-gallon drums, along with spent absorbent material utilized on the facility floor, and recovered all free product. There were no injuries or exposures reported
